newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end up despite profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end up despite profit-taking.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished higher on Thursday despite profit-taking ahead of the Friday-Saturday weekend, dealers said.

They said buying at dips in second-tier stocks and select blue chips had helped the index to counter the impact of profit-taking by individuals. The death of Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping had no effect on the market, they added.

The Karachi 100-share index rose 6.19 points, or 0.35 percent, to close at 1,775.62 with 254 losers and 130 gainers. PTCL rose 0.10 rupees to 34.40 rupees and Hub Power Co 1.0 to 42.40. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
